00010 #ifndef __JMOD_PARAM_H__
00011 #define __JMOD_PARAM_H__
00012 
00013 #ifdef JMOD_MESSAGE
00014 #define OBJECT_CLASS_NAME "jcom.message"
00015 #else
00016 #define OBJECT_CLASS_NAME "jcom.parameter"
00017 #endif
00018 // OBJECT_CLASS_NAME must be defined before this
00019 // TODO: Does this actually work now with the headers in the frameworks? [TAP]
00020 #include "Jamoma.h"
00021 
00022 
00023 #define LISTSIZE 512    // TODO: Discuss longer list support for Max 5
00024 
00025 enum outlets{
00026         k_outlet_set = 0,
00027         k_outlet_direct,
00028         k_outlet_dumpout,
00029         num_outlets
00030 };
00031                         
00032 typedef void (*pf_noargs)(void *x);                     // pointer to a function with only the struct pointer given
00033                                                                                         // must be defined so the struct will know what to do, but can't define it as requiring the struct
00034 #define attr_value                      atom_list[0]
00035 #define attr_valueDefault       atom_listDefault[0]
00036 
00037 typedef struct _param{                                          // Data Structure for this object
00038         t_jcom_core_subscriber_extended common;
00039         pf_noargs                               param_output;                           // bang method for the instance points to an optimized function
00040         void                                    *outlets[num_outlets];  // my outlet array
00041         t_atom                                  atom_list[LISTSIZE];    // was "t_atom attr_value;"     // ATTRIBUTE: The parameter's value
00042         t_atom                                  atom_listDefault[LISTSIZE];
00043         long                                    list_size;
00044         long                                    listDefault_size;
00045         t_symbol                                *attr_ramp;                             // ATTRIBUTE: ramp mode 
00046         long                                    attr_slavemode;                 // ATTRIBUTE: This instance is a slave of another instance, and simply forward anything recieved
00047         long                                    attr_ui_freeze;
00048         float                                   attr_stepsize;                  // ATTRIBUTE: amount to increment or decrement by
00049         long                                    attr_priority;                  // ATTRIBUTE: does this parameter have a priority over other parameters when a preset is recalled?
00050         t_symbol                                *name;                                  // the first arg is the name of the parameter, which is stored by pattr - but we cache it here too...
00051         t_atom                                  name_atom;                              // the above name, but cached as an atom for quick referencing
00052         rampunit                                *ramper;                                
00053         void                                    *ui_qelem;                              // the output to the connected ui object is "qlim'd" with this qelem
00054         void                                    *ramp_qelem;                    
00055         t_symbol                                *attr_rampfunction;             
00056         t_symbol                                *attr_dataspace;                
00057         t_symbol                                *attr_unitActive;               
00058         t_symbol                                *attr_unitNative;               
00059 } t_param;
00060
